revised_title: Fossil Remains of an Animal with Sternum Similarities to Ornithorhynchus Paradoxus
tldr: The author examines fossil remains of an animal with a sternum structure similar to the Ornithorhynchus Paradoxus. They describe the similarities and differences between the fossil animal's sternum and that of the Ornithorhynchus Paradoxus, as well as the muscles attached to it. The author also discusses the animal's mode of breathing and its connection to the chain of gradation in the animal kingdom.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Comparative Anatomy
